listicle_content.listicle: Security arrangements in Haryana have been tightened with the deployment of 48 companies of paramilitary forces.

\"Besides adequate deployment of police personnel, as many as 48 companies of paramilitary forces have been deployed at various places in the state keeping in view the stir call from tomorrow. We have asked for 15 more companies from the Centre,\" Haryana Additional Chief Secretary (Home), Ram Niwas said.
Prohibitory orders under Section 144 of the CrPc have already been imposed in seven sensitive districts of Haryana.
Police are keeping a close watch on anyone trying to spread rumours or make inflammatory statements through social media.

The administration in Haryana\'s Sonipat district has also banned all Internet services. \"With a view to ward off any tension, fights, threats to human life, damage to property and deterioration in the law and order situation, District Magistrate, Sonipat, K. Makarand Pandurang, has issued orders to ban all Internet services, including Internet 2G, 3G, 4G, Edge, GPRS and Bulk SMS sent via mobile, under Section 144 of the Criminal Procedure Code with effect from June 4, 2016.
Haryana administration has suspended internet services in sensitive areas like Rohtak and Jhajjar districts.

Meanwhile, the business community in Haryana which faced massive financial loss during the Jat quota agitation in February this year appealed to Jats to hold a peaceful protest in support of their demands.
Trading community also appealed to BJP-led state government to hold talks with Jat leaders in order to resolve their issues.
During Jat agitation in February, business community in Haryana had suffered massive financial loss as several shops belonging to non-Jats were looted and burnt by arsonists.
As many as 30 people were killed, 320 were injured and property worth hundreds of crores of rupees was destroyed during their agitation in February.

story.storykicker: The Jat community in Haryana begins second round of agitation today.
story.storybody:
The security arrangements in Haryana have been tightened as the Jat community begins a second round of agitation today to press on their demand of an increased quota in government jobs and educational institutes.

According to District Commission of Rohtak, six groups have withdrawn their agitation after negotiations.

"Section 144 has been imposed in all districts, specially in 1 km range on both sides of national highway and railway tracks," Haryana Additional Chief Secretary (Home), Ram Niwas said.

Meanwhile, Jat community leaders have assured the Haryana government that the pro-quota protest will remain peaceful.

HERE ARE THE TOP DEVELOPMENTS:

{funfacts}
  1. Security arrangements in Haryana have been tightened with the deployment of 48 companies of paramilitary forces.
  2. "Besides adequate deployment of police personnel, as many as 48 companies of paramilitary forces have been deployed at various places in the state keeping in view the stir call from tomorrow. We have asked for 15 more companies from the Centre," Haryana Additional Chief Secretary (Home), Ram Niwas said.
  3. Prohibitory orders under Section 144 of the CrPc have already been imposed in seven sensitive districts of Haryana.
  4. Police are keeping a close watch on anyone trying to spread rumours or make inflammatory statements through social media.
  5. The administration in Haryana's Sonipat district has also banned all Internet services. "With a view to ward off any tension, fights, threats to human life, damage to property and deterioration in the law and order situation, District Magistrate, Sonipat, K. Makarand Pandurang, has issued orders to ban all Internet services, including Internet 2G, 3G, 4G, Edge, GPRS and Bulk SMS sent via mobile, under Section 144 of the Criminal Procedure Code with effect from June 4, 2016.
  6. Haryana administration has suspended internet services in sensitive areas like Rohtak and Jhajjar districts.
  7. Meanwhile, the business community in Haryana which faced massive financial loss during the Jat quota agitation in February this year appealed to Jats to hold a peaceful protest in support of their demands.
  8. Trading community also appealed to BJP-led state government to hold talks with Jat leaders in order to resolve their issues.
  9. During Jat agitation in February, business community in Haryana had suffered massive financial loss as several shops belonging to non-Jats were looted and burnt by arsonists.
  10. As many as 30 people were killed, 320 were injured and property worth hundreds of crores of rupees was destroyed during their agitation in February.
{funfacts}

briefcase_content.briefcase: The Jat community begins a second round of agitation today in support of their demands.
Section 144 has been imposed in all districts of Haryana.
Jat community leaders have assured the state government that protest will remain peaceful.
